intro: Dischidia bengalensis var. spathulata, commonly known as the Bengal Dischidia, is a climbing or trailing vine native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its thick, fleshy stems and opposite, heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in umbels, followed by fleshy, red or purple berries. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests. Its unique appearance and ability to climb make it a popular choice for indoor gardening and hanging baskets.
